executiveSummary: Trey and Don Brown, brothers from Los Angeles, pitched their company Ride Fresh—a modern, stylish car air freshener brand—seeking $200,000 for 5%. After a controversial joke about Mark Cuban’s NBA team led to his immediate exit, the remaining Sharks evaluated the business’s $1.1M total sales and $2.1M pending AutoZone deal. Barbara Corcoran ultimately offered $200,000 for 20% contingent on those retail agreements, which the brothers accepted.
keyDecisions: Barbara Corcoran invested $200,000 for 20% equity contingent on two major retail deals being finalized.

actionItems.task: Finalize the two major retail agreements, including the $2.1M AutoZone deal.
Collaborate with Barbara Corcoran to scale Ride Fresh through retail and wholesale channels.

nextSteps: Ride Fresh founders will complete the pending retail partnerships and begin working with Barbara Corcoran to expand retail presence and scale the business nationally.
